page.title: 16QUERNMORE WATER PROJECT 4
page.content: In July 1985 there was a public meeting called by the North West Water Authority to explain their plans for work on the Rowton to Abbeystead tunnel.They will be carrying out explosions to find out where the methane gas is coming from and how much there is.A team of consultant geologists,scientists surveyors and contractors will spend about 10 weeks exploring the surrounding area.Shallow boreholes will be drilled and explosion energy shot into the ground. The Authority plan to keep the findings a secret as they hope to sell the information to interested people. This will help to pay for the survey and save money for the ratepayers. However they say they will tell local landowners and tenants if there are likely to be any health hazards.
